key_points: President Donald Trump faces isolation and calls for resignation amidst efforts for a second impeachment following the Capitol assault.
Despite backlash and social media bans, Trump plans no resignation and aims to highlight policy accomplishments.
Trump's visit to Alamo, Texas, symbolizes defiance, focusing on illegal immigration and border wall efforts.
Second Republican senator, Pat Toomey, joins calls for Trump's resignation, following Alaska's Senator Lisa Murkowski.
Over half of Americans favor Trump's removal from office before his term ends, according to an ABC News/Ipsos poll.
House Democrats move toward a second impeachment, but Senate trial unlikely before Biden's presidency begins.
Jason Miller, a Trump adviser, believes impeachment efforts might backfire on Democrats and unify Republican base.
Trump's refusal to accept election results and incitement of Capitol riot leads to criticism and concern over further actions.
Pence and Trump's relationship fractures, with Pence allies angered over Trump's actions putting Pence and family in danger.
Trump contemplates action against big tech following social media bans, amidst criticism for neglecting presidential duties.
spokespersons: Jason Miller (close adviser to President Trump)
Chris Christie (former New Jersey Governor, longtime friend and informal adviser to Trump)
